strings.Value: {g|Population4_1}[Choice effects]{/g} [Pay 75 BP] "I like this idea. Let us build a consulate in Brevoy."
"We can do without a consulate in Brevoy."
"You can resolve this issue without me."

{n}Octavia looks embarrassed.{/n} "I've come with... a request. Could you find a diplomat to handle negotiations and politics? I lack the stamina to lead complicated discussions... and I don't have time at all for politics. Your subjects grow in number, and their problems multiply. It seems almost everyone demands attention!" {n}The girl smiles timidly.{/n}

"Speaking of their problems: I keep hearing about how difficult it is for your subjects outside the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}. Especially in {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}, these past few weeks. Their merchants overcharge our peasants or use their connections to force our people into a disadvantageous agreements! Why not build a consulate there? I'm sure your subjects will appreciate you taking care of them, even when they travel outside the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}!"

{n}Valerie rubs her temple thoughtfully.{/n} "Your {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom} requires a diplomat, {name}. Relationships with our neighbors require special attention. Appoint a new advisor to manage this aspect of your barony."

"But before you transfer these responsibilities to someone else, I would like to make one suggestion. No country can ignore the interests of its citizens who travel beyond its borders. Our most active trade relations and cultural exchanges are with {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}. I suggest we arrange with them to build a consulate in their capital. Then, all your subjects who visit there can enjoy our support and protection. As I see it, it's a worthy investment."

"{mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}, it's time to hire another advisor. You need someone who can oversee our diplomatic relationships with other countries. Considering your complicated ties to {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}, and the character of the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}, the earlier you find a talented Grand Diplomat, the better."

"Speaking of diplomacy, the project of a consulate in {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} has appeared on my desk. This would be an establishment for your subjects, who find themselves in trouble while traveling there. To my mind it's a waste of money, but I felt duty-bound to inform you personally about this idea."
"Wonderful! I'm glad that we'll be taking care of your subjects even when they're traveling outside the country!"
"Then I shall make the necessary arrangements."
{n}Lander nods.{/n} "I am sure {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness} can find better uses for the {mf|barony's|barony's|kingdom's|kingdon's} resources."
"I will arrange everything. I do hope {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} supports this project!"
"I will send a few letters, and wait for an answer from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}. I think they will approve of the idea of building a consulate."
"Nothing could be simpler! I just won't do anything. The easiest decision of my entire regency!"
